choices: "i'm hungry" or scared or bored or SOMETHING
1112.content:
"Huh? I don't like the dark..." says your infant mind in baby talk, though for the sake of clarity it has been translated to English. "I don't like the dark, but I spend much too much time in it. But in my experience, making a high-pitched screeching noise with my vocal cords and diaphragm means light. It hurts like hell, but... hey, better than this dark prison." You begin to cry loudly enough to shatter the eardrums of the parental unit standing over you, but not loudly enough to frighten the ugly maniacs from the next world. They brought an awful lot of pink-themed clothing over, only to discover that you were a boy. Why they seem to like this world so much better than their own is a mystery to you, but then again, they don't have to lie down in a dark room while your parental units frantically try to shut them up.
"Wheghubb hummi! Alesanerz gryig!" spoke the (male) parental unit to the female in the next dimension. You hear po-po-po-po-po... a sound connected with the travel through dimensions often done by parental units and the pan-universal beings with the pink booties/sweaters/hats/shorts. It gets louder, and soon there is light once more. What now?
1112.title: *ahem* WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!

choices: Go on with Candi and forget your friend
11311.content:
You tried not to meet her bright green eyes, focusing on the "Go Chargers!" banner that was hanging at the end of the hallway instead. Those green eyes. Those same eyes that had watched you admirably complete dance routine after dance routine. Those same eyes that had scanned the A Squad list with you. Those same eyes whose friendship you had been forced to reject by Kelli and Tiffani and all of the other cheerleaders who had changed their names to end with an 'i' just so they could dot it with a heart. You were passing your ex-best friend now and wished for nothing more than to grab her left hand while slapping her right hand, proving you still remembered the secret handshake.
"Hey, c'mon! The pep rally is about to start!" Candi squeals in that 'I'm ten years old and it's my birthday' pitch as she grabs your arm. She drags you through the crowded halls, leaving your past buried.
11311.title: Leaving your friends behind...

You see her mouth moving but hear no words. Then you hear a buzzing noise, but you look up at the bells and they aren't' ringing.

Soon enough, you wake up to your mom pulling the covers off of you and the buzzing sounds ceases. It was all a dream. .

Their pom-poms are poofy.
Their skirts are too short.
Their cheers are so goofy,
(Not even a sport).

They can't do a cartwheel,
Just fall on the floor;
They won't eat a full meal,
And act like a [promiscuous woman!]

They think they're so great
When they date football boys.
It seems almost fate
They get treated like toys.

They think they hot in Abercrombie and Fitch
But all of us know that cheerleading's a b-

About then, your teacher stops, and the class stares at you, wide eyed.

11312112.title: Hiding

choices: Skip your next class, search for the cheerleaders, and find out what they're
113121121.content:
Angry and humiliated, you decide to get revenge on the sickening, carefree broads. After you had lunch, you go to the gym room to have Gym, the class you hate the most. You wait until all of the girls go into the girls' locker room to change into their gym clothes. Once they leave, you, steathily, enter the room. Inside, you shut the door and start looking for their bags and find them without too much trouble. Carefully, you unzip one of their bags and find a waterbottle, just half full. You take it out and open the top. Holding the bottle and cap with one hand, you take out one pack of school salt you took from lunch, rip it open with your teeth, and pour it into the bottle. Then you place the waterbottle back into the bag, exactly as you found it, and zip it up. You do this with all of the other cheerleaders' waterbottles. When you're finished, you smirk and leave the locker room.



You have a smile on your face during the class. You couldn't wait to see the look on their faces when they drink from the bottles. That'll definitely be a Kodak moment to remember. Some of the students eye you, suspiciously, and you stop smiling, making sure you don't make others question you. As soon as class is over, the girls and cheerleaders head to the locker room to change back into their street clothes. You follow and hide behind some lockers. One of the cheerleaders unzips her bag and takes out her waterbottle to drink. You stifle your laughter as she tastes the odd water and spits it into the face of a girl that's on her way to take a shower. The other girls gasp and you bit you lip to keep from exploding with laughter. That scene was priceless. "Gross!" the cheerleader exclaimed, grimacing. "This water has SALT in it!" "Salt?" another cheerleader questions. The first cheerleader coughs and spits, trying to get the bitter taste out of your mouth. "Yeah! Salt!" "Let me taste it," the second one replies. The first cheerleader hands the second one her bottle and she tastes it. The look on her face says that the first girl isn't lying about salt being in the water. She spits it out. "You're right!" the second cheerleader cries. "There IS salt in this!" The rest of the cheerleaders take out their waterbottles and taste the water in them. Instantly, they spit the foul liquid back out. "EWWWWWWWWW!!!" the exclaim in unison. "Someone's gonna pay for this!" the first cheerleader yells. She grabs her things and storms out of the room, not even bothering to get dressed into her street clothes. The others follow, still dressed in their gym clothes. Once they're gone, you burst out laughing. After you've had your laugh, you leave the locker room. Now what do you do?
113121121.title: Salty Revenge

1131211221.content:
'Well, my job's done,' you think, smirking. 'Too bad I can't put THEM in the dumpster.' Satisfied, you head to your next class, which is Math.


When you get to your class, you hear a cheerleader complaing that she can't find her Math book. You smirk again and start walking over to your desk. On the way, you, accidently, bump into the head cheerleader. "Watch where you're going, freak!" she exclaims, glaring. You return the glare, tenfold before moving on to your seat. Some kids laugh at the girl's comment, but you ignore them. Once in your seat, you pull out your Math book, but that's a mistake because the head cheerleader grabs it, saying: "Here's a book for you, Michelle!" You stare at the girl in shock. She just took your one and only Math book from you. What do you do now?
1131211221.title: Math class

13111112.content: Your dad takes his time, strolling down the street to the very bar your mother always told him to stay away from. He pulls a crushed pack of Marlboro's from his pants pocket. He lets out a giggle. She's really dead. Finally, he feels as if a huge weight has been lifted. He'll be meeting "her" there. She will be wearing a red shirt. He pictures her running to him, throwing her arms around his neck and kissing him passionately. He pulls a cigarette from it's sleeve and lights up. He takes a deep breath and shakes his head.A smile still on his face. Rain is starting to fall. He quickens his pace and pulls his old Members Only jacket over his head. He stops at the corner. He sees her waiting for him inside the bar. She slides off the stool and walks to the doorway. "Hey handsome!" she shouts. He waves. He waits for a bus to pass and then steps out into the street. She looks so beautiful . His desire to hold her is almost unbearable.In his mind he is already across the street with her, in the bar, with his arm around her waist, holding her close to him smelling her intoxicating perfume. He didn't see the truck coming. It all happened so fast.
13111112.title: Lost in Thought

1312.content:
You can understand why some one might have done something like this. It costs a lot of money to keep a person on life support for so long. It's been three years since the accident that left you clinging to life like some small child still on her mother's apron strings.

There had been a little girl in the middle of the street trying to get her red ball that she had thrown in the wrong direction. You hadn't seen her until it was too late and the wheels of your car rolled over the her. You remember hearing a scream and then...and then...nothing. There was nothing for a long, long time.

Until now, of course. You can see your family crying, staring at your lifeless body. 'How long have they been there' you wonder. Everything seems hazy as if in a dream. You look up and there is a bright light that is brighter than the sun in a perfectly clear sky. Below you is a dark pit with a faint flickering glow. Faces are in that pit, they are filled with pain and suffering. You realize that you have a choice set before you.
1312.title: Good bye.

131211.content:
...or so you think. While the thought of spending an eternity in a choir had never appealed to you, you decided it was time for peace. So you reach up to the sky and keep ascending through the clouds, but the sight that next meets your eyes is nothing like you were expecting. An immense gate made of an alloy you have never seen stands before you and millions of machines flutter around you. The technology is so beyond your mind that you cannot understand what is going on, but it all glitters of a bright, translucent gold. There is one of the flying machines before you. A figure at the great gate motions you over.

Do you...

1312121.content:
You are born in an unusual place - a crack users home. Yes, you have been born to an uncaring, drug abusing woman who will never remember who your father is, muchless remember to love and care for you.

But even as an infant, you understand that you are not alone - there is another child here, a young girl, maybe two or three years old. Skinny and dirty, you see where your life is headed.

But for just a moment you have a clear vision of your purpose in THIS life, and you must decide if you will carry it out or return to heaven and try for another life.
1312121.title: A rough life ahead

131212121.content:
"Hey, sis, I was calling about your new drug...I want to test it."
The words still echo in your mind from your talk with your sister over the phone. While scared at the thought of testing a new drug, you greatly wish to cling to life. Ever since your reincarnation, you haven't quite remembered what went on in your past life, but the visions of what might have happened to you if you hadn't reincarnated have haunted your dreams. Dark, visceral dreams...unexplainable. Even hell isn't a suitable term for them. You keep hoping that your sister's drug will work. If it doesn't...you're not quite sure what you'll do. The phone rings again, it's your sister...
131212121.title: seek your sister's help to live on

choices: Rant and rage about how the afterlife is unfair

131212122.content: You decide that your life was great, but there is no need to stay. You die eventually and end up back in heaven. You realize that you enjoyed life a lot, and again wish to be reincarnated. To your utter disappointment, nothing happens. You...
131212122.title: A wish...not granted

choices: "I will take this life you offer me,"
"I do not think that love will be worth it,"
1312121222.content:
"Haven't I been an obedient daughter?" you implore him, kneeling before his glorious throne. "Haven't I turned from revenge, from despair? I have done good on earth, Father. Please, send me back!"
"Why do you ask to return to a bleak world? You are with me, now. You will never suffer again."
"I don't think I'm finished there yet."
"You have had two lifetimes, that's more than anyone else can claim,"
"Please, please let me go back." you beg, averting your eyes.
He sighs, shaking his head. "I will put a choice before you, daughter."
You raise your gaze to Him, hopeful tears brimming behind your eyes.
"You may return for one last sorrowful existence, or you may remain with me. I will tell you of your life before you go, and of your death. You will watch the people close to you disappear. You will dwindle and die. It will be agony, knowing the fates to befall each of your family members, each of your friends. You will be unable to share this burden with them. But you will live, and the pain will be punctured by happy moments - simple pleasures."
You gape at Him.
"You will finally have a loving relationship, what you've missed out on in your past lives. You will fall in love with a man perfect for you. But you will lose him. You will lose all of them."
1312121222.title: Audience with God

13122.content:
You descend into the pit filled with the suffering faces. As you sink lower, pain hits you like a tidal wave, and your ears begin to ring with the screams of the others who abide there.

Fighting through the pain-induced haze, you wonder what it was that made you come here.

As the thought sinks in, you realize that there is still a choice to be made, even in this dark, painful pit. You realize that, though you cannot see it, you are standing at a crossroads -- one branch leading to a place darker than dark, the other leading back up.

You move towards the upper branch, but a voice-that-is-not-a-voice stops you, asking the question that you yourself had been wondering moments before: why have you chosen to descend to this point?

You hesitate before answering, knowing that your answer determines the path you will walk.

So, what was your motivation?
13122.title: Crossroads in the depth of pain

131221.content:
You say that you had to know of the contents of the World Below to scratch your curious itch.

The voice answers: "Then come, let me show you these depths."

Apollo, a black dog appears as your guide, but you still have the option to ascend on the upper branch.

Do You:

You turn and run out of the stalls to the mirrors. There crawling all over you!! You scream and as you dart out of the bathroom you dont notice for one second that you didnt pull up your pants and everyone in the restaurant is looking at you, laughing.

"There crawling all over me!!" You panic over the sounds of laughter.

You look down, mortifyed, noticing quickly that it wasnt magets that was crawling on you, it was the tiolet water.
